reviews.text: We ( A family of 3) purchased a 3 night stay on Ebay ($279) 6/22-6/25 and it was worth every penny. Check in good (sales pitch was offered but we politely refused) and that was the end of the pitch. Location not a problem finding the resort,yes sign was a little small, but we were on the look-out for it. Rooms were good they consisted of the entire 1st floor
reviews.title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY AT

reviews.text: bldg# 41-102,103 slept a total of 8 ppl. Very clean. No noise at all as some reviews complained about. only minor problems Toilet in 1 unit was not properly secured.
reviews.title: Good location, good value.

reviews.text: I would recommened this to others Busch Gardens 10 minute drive.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Turn into the road that shows a sign for Ramada 1776. Small sign for Patriots place!!
reviews.title: Dont stay Here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We, family of 4, stayed at the Wyndham Patriots Place in the week of June 14th 2009. It looked to me as all renovations have been completed, the pool is open and all seems well. Check-in on Sunday at 3pm took about 5 minutes, good customer service upon (Randy) check -in. No push for additional tours and packages. They said that the place is full and I believe it. It is still quite all around. We had a 1 bedroom appartment with the sofa sleeper for the kids. The appartment is what you expect to get. It has all the essentials and you are given a refresh kit upon check-in.
reviews.title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thought this Wyndham was very quaint, looks like it used to be a residential community turned timeshare. You stay in houses that were converted into 4 mini condo's, our room was clean, didn't encounter any bugs. The walls are very thin, heard our neighbors clinging pots and pans during the evening... not a very big deal since it was quiet during the time we were sleeping. The employee's at the front desk were very pleasant and helpful, going out of their way to make you feel at home. The pool was nice, although you are surrounded by tree's so there are lots of bugs... but nothing too crazy, you learn to just deal with it. I believe they may still be renovating since the TV in our bedroom was an older style TV while the TV in the living room was a flat screen, not a big deal... but we found that a bit odd. The only problem we came across was when it came time to the typical time share up sell/upgrade. Two guys came to our room, knocked on the door about 15 minutes after we checked in. One of the guys started off by being pushy, asking why I haven't upgrading since I bought the timeshare and said I was suppose to based on the package I bought. His tone and words just turned me off and I told him I wasn't interested in a presentation during my stay with them. He wouldn't take that for an answer, he said it would only be 15 minutes (LOL) and they would give us breakfast and gifts. I told him we were only their for 2 days and didn't want to use up any time with a presentation when we have no interest in upgrading at the moment. After a little more back n forth he finally told me he would put a "Decline" on my account and that was that. He turned around and left looking annoyed and never giving me the Welcome Kit I was told I was going to receive (not sure if that was out of spite or not). So, everything except for THAT experience was very nice and I would recommend this Wyndham to any timeshare owner looking to visit Williamsburg for a few days.
reviews.title: A nice Wyndham to stay at when visiting Williamsburg, VA

reviews.text: Travelled here with my mom and sisters for a little weekend girls getaway. It was their first time at a Wyndham property and my first time at this particular property. Check in was speedy. No pressure to come to one of the sales pitches. The concierge just listed the times on a piece of paper. We got a reminder call on Saturday morning, and when we said no we weren't interested, she said okay and wished us a happy visit/stay. We had a 2 BR Lockout Unit. Perfect for our group of 5. Both units were very clean and well stocked (dishes/utensils) with everything we could need. The extra pillows I requested when we checked in arrived within minutes of us getting to our units. Only one puzzling thing was the 1776 Hotel that is also on the grounds. Couldn't tell what relationship, if any, it had with Wyndham. It seemed vacant and it looked out of place with the rest of the grounds. Just curious.
reviews.title: Excellent place that I wouldn't mind staying again.

reviews.text: Speaking of the grounds. They were great! With sitting areas around the two "ponds" (lit at night) one could go for a nice stroll. All in all, absolutely no complaints about Patriots Place. Just a tip, it is a bit hard to see the Wyndham sign, especially at night, but my confirmation letter warned of this so we were on the look out for it and had no problems locating the hotel.
reviews.title: Horrible experience- very noisy

reviews.text: The walls are paper thin here and my 3 year old son was kept up for 3 hours past his bedtime every night so far that we have been here because of the neighbor's tv. I have stayed in time shares since I was young- for almost 30 years. This is the FIRST time I have ever experienced anything this bad. I called to complain but the front desk couldn't do anything because it wasn't quiet hours yet (which start at 11:00, which is a little absurd to begin with). The kitchen is small, which is fine, but we do most of our cooking in our room on trips like this. There are only 4 plates, 4 cups, etc.- which is hard for a family of 3 that eats 3 meals in the room most days. I have washed lots of dishes.
reviews.title: COCK ROACHES!

reviews.text: There are several Wyndham properties in Wiliamsburg and we have had good experiences at the other ones, but will never stay here again. It is not a good place for a family with small children to stay.
reviews.title: When I see negative reviews I always wonder if I stayed at the same place.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I booked a 3 day getaway at Patriot's Place from 12/28. We came home after 2 nights. We had a 1 bedroom unit. We last stayed at Patriot's Place about 10 years ago. They've updated the furnishings and have re-done the bathrooms but needed to address some other issues too. First, it's awful to be on the first floor, the construction is so poor that when your neighbor walks across the floor above you it's LOUD! The first night they were up to 12:30 and the 2nd night I called at 2:30AM to ask they to try to be quiet. We were planning to spend the next day in Colonial Williamsburg and had lights out at 11pm. The gentleman who answered apologized and said that they were going to be shortly but 7am came very early! We were so tired we just came home!
reviews.title: Great location, shoddy construction!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The kitchen cabinets are way too high. They do supply a stepstool and you need it if you want anything on any of the shelves but the first one. They've re-done the bathrooms removing the jetted tub and replacing it with a shallow soaking tub. The bathroom sinks are nice but very tall and it's awkward if not impossible to get near the mirror to apply makeup.
reviews.title: How quaint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was quick and as owners we were offered 2 colonial Williamsburg passes for 45 minutes of our time. We ended up wasting the day there, 6 hours. It was our fault for just not leaving. DO NOT attend a sales presentation or update unless you can be very firm.
reviews.title: Fantastic Condo - will return next year!

reviews.text: Check-out was also very quick. The location is great, just a couple miles to the Colonial Williamsburg Visitor's center. Hint: If you are going just to walk around park behind the Sheild's Tavern. We usually do that and then have lunch.
reviews.title: Too Noisy, and Doors make it so you cannot have any privacy from neighbors

reviews.text: We enjoy Williamsburg but I will stay at Patriot's Place again only if I know I have an upstairs unit.
reviews.title: YIKES. Loudest, loudest, loudest place, did I say loud?

reviews.text: We too were very nervous at what we would find upon arrival!! Needless to say everything bad in the reviews below we found to be untrue. Now, maybe they have addressed and corrected since the reviews were written but as of our trip everything was perfect. Great location, clean, quiet, not pushy on the time share, plenty to do, found the location without any issue, quick check -in, prompt response to housekeeping requests, and nothing negative to write from this stay!!
reviews.title: Don't be scared away by the bad reviews below!!

reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical after having read some of the reviews but was pleasantly surprised to find that it was a lovely place. I visited July 4th weekend with my husband, children, nephew and mother. Check in was quick and easy and the staff was extremely friendly. The room was clean, comfortable and located close to many restaurants. Colonial Williamsburg and the Parks are also a short drive away. We had a great time and would definitely visit in the future.
reviews.title: Had a fabulous Time!

reviews.text: My Family and I were very pleased with our stay! The Room was great and very clean and very quiet! The decor was very Colonial which is a staple of the location. The pool was great but not small child friendly. We had a wonderful stay and will return to this resort.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL PLACE TO STAY!!
Beautiful and close to the action
reviews.text: Our condo was very large and updated. The views were wonderful and for me and my boyfriend the bathroom arangement was perfect as we both had a side to ourself and could get ready at the same time. Everything was located with in 8 mins. from our condo making it a perfect location.

Read all prior reviews and we (4 of us) were very pleasantly surprised with this resort! We went in early May and it was very quiet and facilities not crowded probably because kids still in school. Our resort two bedroom unit was on the first floor. You could hear walking above from second floor occupants but nothing too distracting. The location is perfect - very central to Colonial Williamsburg, Yorktown and Jamestown and lots of reasonable restaurants close by. We were NOT nagged to buy a time share. We simply said "no thanks" to the welcome breakfast. Don't hesitate to check in to this jewel of a resort. And use their sister resorts amenities. We used their pool and fitness center a short drive away then drove back to our more peaceful accommodations!
reviews.title: Read all prior reviews and we (4 of us...
